title: A Phase 1b, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Multiple Doses of SHR-1707 in Patients With Mild Cognitive Impairment Due to Alzheimer's Disease and Mild Alzheimer's Disease
description_brief: To evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of SHR-1707 in patients with mild cognitive impairment (MCI) due to Alzheimer's disease (AD) and mild AD for 26 weeks.
drug: SHR-1707 (humanized anti–amyloid-β IgG1 monoclonal antibody; binds Aβ fibrils and monomers, promotes Aβ clearance)
explanation_target: Reason: The investigational agent SHR-1707 is a humanized monoclonal antibody that binds amyloid-β (Aβ) species (fibrils and monomers) and is being developed to reduce brain Aβ deposition — i.e., it targets Alzheimer’s pathology (amyloid). citeturn0search3turn0search4

Act: The trial title and description state this is a Phase 1b randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled multiple-dose study of SHR-1707 in patients with MCI due to AD and mild AD for 26 weeks, confirming the intervention and therapeutic intent (amyloid-targeting biologic). citeturn0search0turn0search5

Reflect: Given SHR-1707 is a monoclonal antibody directed at Aβ (a biologic targeting core AD pathology), it fits the definition of a "disease-targeted biologic." It is not a small molecule, a general cognitive enhancer, nor an intervention aimed at neuropsychiatric symptoms. No meaningful ambiguity in category based on available descriptions. citeturn0search3turn0search5
